• The present invention is a device and algorithm for a combined cardiomyostimulator and cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator for cardiac assist systems.
• The system provides muscle-powered cardiac assistance through skeletal muscle graft stimulation and cardiac stimulation.
• The device features a unique algorithm for detecting and responding to arrhythmias by inhibiting muscle stimulation during arrhythmic events.
• Muscle stimulation is also provided during charging for defibrillation to maintain cardiac perfusion and minimize defibrillation thresholds.
• Different muscle stimulation burst patterns can be used to optimize the force and velocity of skeletal muscle contractions for cardiac assistance. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an accommodating intraocular lens device designed for implantation in the lens chamber of a subject's eye.
• Cataract surgery is a common procedure, but conventional IOL devices do not correct for presbyopia, leading to a need for accommodating IOLs.
• The IOL device comprises an elastically deformable lens chamber and a base lens, with the lens chamber responding to radially compressive forces for accommodation.
• The lens chamber may be filled with a gel or fluid with specific physical and chemical characteristics to enhance refractive power and range of accommodation.
• Different embodiments of the IOL device include features like through-holes, raised protrusions, and hinge mechanisms to optimize fluid exchange and accommodate the eye's natural movements.
• The IOL device is designed to be implanted in the capsular bag of the eye, centered along the optical axis, and engage with the zonules for proper functionality.
• Various materials, thickness profiles, and refractive indices are utilized to ensure effective transmission of accommodative forces and range of accommodation.
• The IOL device may be constructed with different elastomeric materials with varying Young's modulus to optimize the response to radially compressive forces.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a continuation of a prior application for an esophageal displacement electrode used for medical procedures like defibrillation and pacing the heart.
• The esophageal-stomach electrode is designed to be inserted into the esophagus and stomach to stimulate the ventricle of the heart in cooperation with an external chest electrode.
• The electrode includes a semi-rigid plastic tube with an electrode at the distal end, capable of bending back on itself to displace the stomach wall towards the heart.
• A control mechanism with cords connected to a rigid pin inside the tube allows for the bending and displacement of the electrode.
• The electrode is positioned close to the heart to reduce the electrical power needed for pacing or defibrillation.
• The control mechanism at the proximal end of the tube enables the user to manipulate the electrode's position inside the stomach.
• The electrode can be easily withdrawn after the procedure by releasing tension on the cords and returning the tube to its original position.
• The invention provides a non-invasive and efficient method for placing the electrode close to the heart, reducing the energy required for medical procedures. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a board game with a lake theme, involving players acquiring lake areas, boat dealerships, and dams.
• Players move tokens around the board, purchasing properties, paying rent, and improving their properties with lake cabins and marinas.
• Makin A Wake and Sunken Chest cards add ups and downs to the game, with penalties, benefits, and instructions for players.
• Players can go to jail, collect money from passing GO, and face financial challenges that may lead to bankruptcy.
• The goal of the game is to bankrupt all other players, with the last player standing declared the winner.
• The game continues until all but one player is bankrupt, making the remaining player the winner of the game.
</summary>

<summary>
* An apparatus for treating tissues and wounds includes a movable rest connected to a pole, a fluid reservoir placed on the rest, and means for controlling fluid supply and suction.
* The apparatus allows for administration of a restricted amount of fluid to the supply port of a dressing pad during continuous suctioning through a separate drainage port.
* Methods for treating tissues involve eliminating hydrostatic pressure, maintaining fluid flow rates, and providing a seal for negative pressure distribution.
* In regenerative treatment, methods involve eliminating hydrostatic pressure, maintaining fluid flow rates, and applying loading doses continuously or intermittently.
* An apparatus for regenerative treatment includes a drainage port with means to prevent occlusion of the dressing pad's open pores during continuous suction.
* An apparatus for detecting bleeding during treatment includes a receptacle, scale, canister, movement buffer organs, computer, display, alarm, and telemetry.
* Methods for detecting bleeding involve determining baseline fluid formation rates, setting a threshold for bleeding detection, and using a computer to monitor and alert for bleeding.
* Overall, the apparatus and methods described aim to improve tissue treatment and regeneration by controlling fluid supply, maintaining pressure levels, and detecting complications like bleeding. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a gravity-driven steerable vehicle designed for downhill racing on various terrains.
* It features a chassis with a rider riding surface in a prone, face down position.
* The vehicle has front and rear axle assemblies for steering and stability.
* The braking system includes hydraulic or mechanical brakes for deceleration and halting.
* Shock absorbers are integrated into the wheels to dampen rough terrain impact.
* A combination rear roll bar and transport bail provide safety and towing capabilities.
* The suspension system allows for precise control and carving turns on snow-covered surfaces.
* The ski assembly can be retrofitted with skis, wheels, or a combination for enhanced performance.
* The braking system on the skis includes a blade that extends for braking on snow or ice.
* The integrated body and frame design simplifies assembly and maximizes strength and stiffness. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention discloses a wave-based imaging method and apparatus employing Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography for imaging objects in a surrounding medium, such as characterizing vulnerable plaque in arteries or non-destructively evaluating buried wastes or parts with existing access holes.
* The method utilizes a Hilbert Space Inverse Wave algorithm to map angular locations and frequency parameters of scattered energy waves to construct images of objects, providing improved lateral resolution and elastic property characterization for applications in intravascular imaging, borehole characterization, and non-destructive evaluation of materials.
</summary>

<summary>
• The biological oil composition derived from marine copepods, particularly Calanus finmarchicus, has shown significant anti-atherosclerotic effects in preventing plaque formation in atherosclerosis.
• The composition contains high levels of wax esters, stearidonic acid (SDA), eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), which contribute to its beneficial effects on cardiovascular health.
• Compared to concentrated EPA/DHA preparations, the copepod oil composition demonstrated a more pronounced reduction in atherosclerotic plaque formation and blood cholesterol levels in experimental mice.
• The oil composition is suitable for use in dietary supplements, functional foods, and pharmaceutical products for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases.
• The unique chemical composition of the copepod oil, including high levels of wax esters and specific fatty acids, sets it apart from traditional fish oils and krill oils, making it a novel and promising anti-atherosclerotic composition.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pharmacological compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes in microparticulate form with active substances embedded in the matrix, bound to a partner, or part of the complex itself.
* Polyelectrolyte complexes can be composed of macromolecular compounds with ions of opposite charge, forming gels or precipitates from aqueous solutions.
* These complexes can be prepared from biocompatible, biodegradable polyacids and polybases, with the ability to control particle size and distribution for various pharmaceutical applications.
* Active substances can be incorporated into the complexes through entrapment, absorption, chemical binding, or by being a partner in the formation of the complex.
* The complexes have shown potential for controlled release of active substances, such as cytostatics, proteins, vaccines, and contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis.
* Release tests have demonstrated the ability of these complexes to release active substances over time, with specific release profiles tailored to different therapeutic or diagnostic applications.
* Overall, polyelectrolyte complex microparticles offer a versatile and effective platform for the delivery of active substances in pharmaceutical formulations. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a golf ball teeing device that allows golfers to insert a tee into the ground with a ball on top without bending over, addressing difficulties faced by elderly or physically challenged golfers.
* Prior art devices required manual unclamping controls mounted on long poles, making them heavy, cumbersome, and visually unappealing, with multiple moving parts increasing production costs.
* The present invention eliminates the need for a manual unclamping mechanism, allowing a golf club to be used as the handle, making the device lightweight, portable, and easy to use without the need for juggling between the device and the club.
* The device securely holds the ball and tee, automatically unclamps once the tee is inserted into the ground, and can also be used to retrieve the tee, providing a simple, efficient, and user-friendly solution for teeing up golf balls without bending over.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present application is a continuation of a previous U.S. application and European Application, relating to a person support apparatus for hospital or long-term care beds.
* The apparatus includes a deck support frame with leg assemblies and actuators for adjusting the height and orientation of the patient support surface.
* The leg assemblies are pivotally connected to the deck support frame and have rollers that run along inverted U-shaped channels on the sides of the frame.
* This design allows for smooth movement of the deck support frame, reducing friction and the risk of trapping fingers in the mechanism.
* The apparatus can be adjusted to raise, lower, or tilt the patient support surface into Trendelenburg or reverse Trendelenburg positions.
* The use of rollers inside the channels reduces the force needed to adjust the height of the deck support frame.
* The channel design prevents dirt from entering and interfering with the mechanism, making it more durable and reliable.
* A braking mechanism is incorporated into the castors at the foot and head ends of the bed, activated by the movement of the deck support frame.
* The braking lever is engaged by the underside of the channel element when the bed is lowered to lock the castors in place.
* Variations and modifications exist within the scope of the disclosure, as defined in the following claims. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a skin reflectance measuring apparatus used in pathology and cosmetology.
* Existing methods for measuring surface reflectance in industry are not suitable for skin reflectance.
* The apparatus includes a probe with fiber optics, a measuring device, and a display.
* The probe is small, allowing measurements on small skin surfaces with flexibility.
* The apparatus compensates for variations in emitted light and ambient light for accurate measurements.
* The light emitting device includes a lamp, lens, and infrared filter for optimal light intensity.
* The receiving device uses photodiodes to measure specular and diffuse reflection.
* Calibration is done by measuring light flux and calculating correction factors.
* The measuring operation involves cycles of measuring specular and diffuse reflection.
* Results show a correlation between visual reflectance and measured values, validating the apparatus's effectiveness. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus designed to provide a higher degree of cleansing and promote dental health.
* The apparatus consists of a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members that fit over the teeth and snugly against the gums.
* Pneumatic means are provided to move the channel members to massage the gums, while hydraulic means clean the teeth and gingival crevices.
* The apparatus operates by providing air pulses to inflate and deflate air-sacks for massaging, along with a steady stream of water or cleaning fluid for cleaning.
* Control box allows for different modes of operation, including air only, water only, or a combination of both, and a remote control device is provided for convenience. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically addressing pelvic organ prolapse (POP) in women.
* The invention includes anterior and posterior implants with straps for threading into ligaments, loops for anchoring to the cervix and perineal body, and spaces for weight reduction.
* A needle is used for threading the straps through ligaments, with a trap for securing the strap, a tip for threading, and a mechanism for releasing the trap.
* The needle allows threading from the accessible side of the tissue without additional perforations, providing reliable anchoring of the mesh implant.
* The method involves trapping the strap, threading it through the tissue, releasing the trap, and returning the needle to the accessible side while abandoning the strap at the threaded point.
* The surgeon can operate the needle from outside the surgical area, inserting it into ligaments through the vaginal opening, and securing the strap without the need for additional incisions. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The second embodiment of the apparatus is designed for patients with varying respiratory mechanics, abnormal chemoreceptor reflexes, or hypoventilation syndromes.
• The apparatus includes measurements of flow and pressure, calculations for leak conductance, and fuzzy logic algorithms for phase detection and ventilation control.
• Parameters such as target ventilation, respiratory rate, and duty cycle are user-adjustable to customize treatment for each patient.
• The system dynamically adjusts time constants for leak conductance calculations based on recent changes in leakage flow.
• Fuzzy inference rules are used to determine the phase in the respiratory cycle, taking into account various features of the flow-vs-time curve.
• Defuzzification is performed to calculate the instantaneous phase based on the fuzzy rules and weights assigned to each rule.
• The system also includes calculations for hyperpnea, hypopnea, and detection of sudden changes in leakage flow.
• The apparatus is capable of operating in various treatment modes, including CPAP, bilevel spontaneous, and proportional assist ventilation.
• The algorithms and calculations in the apparatus provide immunity to sudden leaks and adjust the degree of assistance based on the patient's respiratory needs.
• Overall, the second embodiment offers a comprehensive and adaptive approach to ventilatory assistance for patients with complex respiratory conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument primarily used in laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
• The instrument includes a rigid arm extending between the working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve to improve visualization of the operation site.
• Different embodiments of the instrument feature working tip electrodes in various shapes such as a hook or flattened spatula.
• An insulating jacket is placed on the arm to prevent unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue.
• The arm is laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve to enhance the surgeon's view of the working tip electrode.
• The instrument is designed for easy handling and use, and can be connected to a conventional electro-surgical unit for controlled electrical energy delivery. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, transmit/receive coils, and adjustable exposure positions.
• Known MRI apparatuses require adjustment of exposure parameters for different positions, leading to readjustment time of 10 to 90 seconds per position.
• The adjustment optimizes RF chain and magnetic field homogeneity in the imaging volume.
• Patient-dependent adjustments are necessary for safety and image quality.
• The invention determines adjustment parameters in advance, allowing for quick high-contrast exposures without readjustment.
• Adjustment parameters are stored for reuse during the examination.
• The apparatus allows for examination of larger body segments without compromising image quality.
• The adjustment process precedes the exposure process, resulting in reduced examination times and continuous tracking of contrast agent. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to fasteners for albums like photographic albums and scrapbooks.
* Conventional albums use male and female screws for fastening, which can be inconvenient to use.
* The present invention provides a fastener with strap anchors and a strap for easy insertion and removal of pages.
* The strap anchors have channels with locking lips to securely hold the strap in place.
* The strap is designed with chamfers for easy insertion and removal from the channels.
* The straps can be adhesively attached to the covers of the album.
* The fasteners allow for easy adjustment of the album thickness by adding or replacing pages.
* A modified embodiment includes saw-tooth profile ribs for improved strap fixation in the channels. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a sulky with two wheels on the same axis, designed for trotting races.
• Traditional sulkies are made of welded steel for strength, but attempts with aluminum have failed due to poor strength.
• The new sulky design allows for lightweight materials like aluminum, making it easy to assemble and transport.
• The end frames are casted for stability, with shafts and crossbar transferring load to the wheel planes.
• The sulky is designed for easy assembly by the user using simple tools, with secure connections.
• The weight of the sulky is reduced by 40% compared to traditional sulkies, weighing approximately 18 kg.
• The sulky can be colored using color tapes for individual customization, enhancing user appeal.
• The sulky can be packed flat for storage and transportation, with identical end frames for easy assembly. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly in water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts.
* Prior to operation, air must be removed from the cooling system to prevent overheating and blockages in the flow paths.
* The invention provides a bypass system with inlets around the axis of rotation to automatically remove air bubbles from the system.
* Different embodiments of the bypass system are shown, including arrangements in end faces of feed pipes, radial pipes, and coiled pipes.
* The bypass system increases hydrodynamic resistance to ensure efficient removal of air bubbles while maintaining a simple design.
* Overall, the ventilation system of the invention effectively eliminates air bubbles in rotating water feeds, improving the efficiency of water-cooled generators. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft and a retaining part connected through an energy absorption connection and a break-away connection.
* The steering column is adjustable in length and height or inclination, with a securement device holding the jacket unit in place against displacement in the longitudinal direction.
* The energy absorption connection includes a bending wire or strip that is elastically prestressed to absorb energy in the event of a crash, reducing the force peak during break-away and providing a dampening effect on noise. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of vehicles using flat, uncurved glass panels.
• Conventional methods involve pre-contouring and tempering glass panels, making them less flexible and more brittle.
• Pre-contoured glass panels are more expensive and prone to shattering in accidents, compromising vehicle safety.
• The new method involves flexing flat glass panels to fit curved window openings and using adhesive sealant to secure them in place.
• Resilient clips and reveal molding are used to hold the glass panel in place and maintain its curved shape.
• The method allows for the use of inexpensive flat glass panels, reducing costs for consumers.
• The adhesive sealant cures to permanently fix the glass panel in the window opening, providing structural support in case of accidents.
• The method is applicable to various vehicle windows and ensures the glass remains intact during impacts.
• The use of flat, uncontoured glass panels and adhesive sealant provides a cost-effective and safe alternative to pre-contoured glass.
• The invention offers a practical solution for installing curved glass windows in vehicles, improving safety and reducing expenses. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an apparatus for removing gas from a liquid, particularly oxygen from water, using a series of gasification chambers with gas ingesting and mixing mechanisms to displace the gas with an inert gas like nitrogen, resulting in reduced vessel height requirements and capital costs.
* The method involves introducing the liquid with the undesired gas into the chambers, where the second gas displaces the first gas, collecting it in the vapor space of each chamber, and removing it through tank breathers, ultimately achieving significant reduction in the concentration of the undesired gas in the liquid.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosure relates to a packaging machine with multiple work stations arranged in succession in a production direction.
• The machine includes a shaft that drives movable tool members of the work stations, synchronizing their movements.
• Transfer mechanisms convert the shaft's rotational movement into the required tool member movements.
• The transfer mechanisms may include toggle levers or cam mechanisms with wear-reducing elements.
• The shaft can be driven continuously or alternately in different directions.
• Work stations may include forming, sealing, and cutting stations, with tool members driven by the shaft.
• The machine can have work stations on different vertical levels for a more compact design.
• Tool members can be displaced in the production direction, and the machine frame supports the shaft for stability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to finishing articles with a mounting hub for quick attachment to power tools.
• Traditional methods of securing grinding wheels to drive shafts involved multiple loose parts and tools for removal.
• Adhesives were used to secure mounting hubs to grinding wheels, but rotational movement could still occur.
• Keyways and key structures were developed to prevent rotational movement between the hub and wheel.
• The new invention involves a backing flange, retaining nut, and pressure cap for secure attachment without adhesives.
• The pressure cap provides compression during use, preventing rotation of the grinding wheel.
• The assembly is easy to assemble, lightweight, and vibration-free.
• The design accommodates various sizes of grinding wheels.
• The disposable finishing article assembly meets safety standards and is cost-effective. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system that diverts pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons away from vulnerable electrical components, ensuring the unit remains sealed from the environment.
* The unit includes conduit portions to collect pressure fluid from the cam element chamber and divert it to spring chambers, preventing damage to the electric motor and other components.
* By utilizing dual conduit portions and pressure equalization conduits, the unit achieves cost savings, hermetic sealing, and protection against water ingress, ensuring optimal functionality and longevity of the hydraulic unit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system with a third dog for transferring carriers between predetermined paths.
* The third dog is selectively operable to transfer carriers across short or long distances, accommodating various system requirements.
* The system allows for efficient and cost-effective transfer of carriers without changing the elevation of the power and free tracks. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a conductive liner for railroad car center plate assemblies, eliminating the need for additional grounding apparatus.
• The liner is made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene mixed with 2% carbon black for conductivity.
• The liner fills the space between the truck bolster bowl and body bolster center plate, providing self-lubricating properties and electrical conductivity.
• Different embodiments include a dished bowl liner, a flat horizontal disk, and a full bowl liner with a conductive ring.
• The liner ensures swiveling action of the car trucks, meets electrical conductivity standards, and minimizes friction.
• The design optimizes mechanical, chemical, and electrical traits to provide a conductive, self-lubricating rail car center bowl liner. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a gate valve for dispensing viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches.
• It can be operated with one hand, making it ideal for fast-food restaurants.
• The valve provides a seal when closed and allows for variable flow when open.
• It can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily.
• The valve is mounted on the spout of a bag and can be used in a dispenser.
• The gate valve member can be moved between opened and closed positions with one hand.
• The valve allows for gradual or quick movement from opened to closed positions.
• It functions effectively even when the bag carrying the valve is mounted in an inclined position.
• The valve provides complete cut-off and an effective seal when closed. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a vehicular rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of a vehicle control output, such as reverse-gear indication. The system includes a mirror control responsive to the vehicle control output, determining the protocol by monitoring the output and concluding the state of the vehicle. The mirror control may be a microcomputer with software processing, adjusting the reflectance level of the reflective element based on the protocol. The system can be used with various vehicles without the need for hardware modifications.

• The system utilizes a power-up sequence and a main sequence to determine the protocol of the vehicle control output. The power-up sequence compares the running average parameter with set limits to establish the protocol, while the main sequence adjusts the parameters based on the vehicle operation. By utilizing software-based protocol determination, the system can be cost-effective and adaptable to different vehicle protocols. The invention provides a solution for determining the protocol of the vehicle control output, allowing for a versatile rearview mirror system. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, specifically focusing on incorporating an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension. This device responds to the brake force applied to the front wheel, helping to minimize variations in angular deceleration and improve braking efficiency.
* The anti-dive unit controls the contracting action of the front fork in response to the operation of the front wheel brake, suppressing vertical chassis vibration and facilitating front wheel braking. By quickly increasing the grounding load on the front wheel, the system minimizes variations in angular deceleration and enhances overall braking efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a movable partition system for cargo transport, allowing for different temperature zones.
* It addresses the inefficiency of cooling entire cargo spaces when not fully utilized.
* The system includes panels that can be independently moved and attached to ceiling-mounted rails.
* Panels can slide towards the front or rear of the trailer to create multiple temperature zones.
* The panels can also be raised and secured to the ceiling when not in use.
* Various mounting mechanisms and rail configurations can be used for flexibility.
* The system allows for easy separation and stowing of panels, even in tight spaces.
* Panels can be secured together to create full-width bulkheads.
* Different means of securing panels together are possible, such as straps or channels.
* The invention offers multiple embodiments for customization and efficiency in cargo transport. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve designed for use in liquid chromatography to separate and purify biological macromolecules in the pharmaceutical industry.
• The valve features a novel diaphragm seal that allows for partial separation of the rotor-stator faces to enable flushing across the process fluid-contacting surfaces.
• The valve design includes integral dynamic wipe sealing lips, barrier fluid flow paths, and make-before-break grooves to prevent leakage and accumulation of dried material.
• The valve can be used in applications such as counterflow simulated moving bed liquid chromatography, where it facilitates efficient separation of components in a continuous process.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention pertains to gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies for higher efficiency operation in distillation columns.
* The invention addresses the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid on trays, utilizing directional thrust valves and tray construction.
* The improved valve-tray assembly includes circular tray valves with wider frontal legs to divert liquid flow, reducing back-trapping and promoting directional thrust of vapor.
* The method and apparatus enhance vapor-liquid flow efficiency by utilizing smaller, more densely spaced valves with directional thrust capabilities, reducing back mixing and increasing mass transfer efficiency in process columns.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure, reducing variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure.
* The assembly is designed to be inexpensive, lightweight, and portable, reducing the size and cost of the regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure.
* A vane motor is used to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical power, which can then be further converted into rotational or electrical energy.
* The vane motor consists of vanes that rotate to drive a generator, providing electricity for various applications such as driving a rotisserie on a gas grill.
* In an alternative embodiment, multiple vane motors can be used to produce electricity and mechanical work from a high-pressure fluid source.
* Another alternative embodiment shows the use of a vane motor in a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus to extract work from compressed air and power electrical appliances like a headlight.
* The invention allows for the extraction of work from pressurized fluid while reducing pressure, enabling the use of smaller or more cost-effective pressure regulators. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pallet systems that facilitate loading and unloading, and limit the shifting of loaded items, such as trays of eggs.
* The pallet system includes raised guide rails on a pallet to support trays with side supports, end stops to limit movement, and end plates for stability and protection.
* Trays are loaded by sliding them onto the pallet along the guide rails, which also help interlock adjacent trays and restrict lateral movement.
* The components of the pallet system, including the pallet cap and end plates, can be customized for different loads and are made of materials like plastic using various manufacturing methods.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension for aviation aircrafts.
* The design includes a compact structure with magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels and an electromotive ring.
* The system avoids contact and friction between the high-speed rotary wing and the saucer shell.
* The design also includes improvements for overcoming reactive torque and enhancing power performance. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, produced through recombinant DNA technology.
• These muteins are used for isolating, purifying, and detecting biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins, with a higher binding strength than conventional streptavidin systems.
• The muteins have mutations in the amino acid positions 44 to 53 of streptavidin, resulting in at least a 5-fold increase in binding affinity for specific peptide ligands like strep-tag and strep-tag II.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, which are derived from various nickel alloys and compounds.
• Guanidines are important in drug development, and the methods aim to provide high yields under mild reaction conditions with minimal reagents.
• The guanylation reactions involve reacting guanylating agents like thioureas or isothioureas with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
• The reactions are carried out at room temperature in solvent systems like DMF, THF, or DMSO, resulting in high yields of guanidines after relatively short reaction times.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
* Conventional methods for coloring aluminum have issues with weatherability and fading over time.
* The new method involves anodizing the aluminum first and then electrolytically coloring it.
* The thickness of the oxide film formed during anodization is crucial for achieving desired colors.
* The electrolytic coloring bath contains various salts and acids to achieve different colors.
* The apparatus includes baths for degreasing, etching, anodic oxidation, electrolytic coloring, and sealing.
* The aluminum strip or wire acts as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and a cathode in the coloring bath.
* The current density and electrolytic period are controlled to achieve desired colors.
* The apparatus allows for continuous operation without the need to connect the aluminum strip or wire directly to a power source.
* The method results in colored aluminum with high weatherability and fade resistance. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention describes a process for assembling a DNA sequence of interest in planta from precursor vectors, allowing for rapid and efficient transformation of plant cells with the desired DNA sequence.
* The process involves providing plant cells with at least two different vectors, adapted for site-specific recombination and integration into the chromosome, resulting in the formation of a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest.
* Different recombinases/integrases can be used for the site-specific recombination, and auxiliary sequences can be included to aid in the assembly process and facilitate selection of transformed plant cells.
* The assembled DNA sequence of interest can contain functional genes, selectable markers, and counter-selectable markers, allowing for efficient screening and removal of unwanted precursor vector sequences from the transformed plant cells.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas by rotating a swash plate and applying a fluorocarbon coating to reduce frictional wear.
* Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems for many years, with the swash plate rotating about a shaft and reciprocating pistons arranged radially around it.
* Coatings have been applied to aluminum swash plates to reduce wear, with prior coatings requiring high silicon aluminum base materials and complex electroplating processes.
* The present invention introduces a coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious additive, and load bearing additive directly bonded to the aluminum swash plate.
* The coating allows for the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base materials without the need for metal plating or high finish polishing.
* The coating is applied through a liquid spray and cured in an oven, providing a durable and low friction surface on the swash plate.
* Experimental results show that the coated swash plates exhibit significantly higher seizure loads and lower friction coefficients compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates.
* The coating process eliminates the need for expensive high silicon aluminum base materials and complex electroplating processes, providing a cost-effective and efficient solution.
* The coating is mechanically bonded to the aluminum surface, providing high durability and low friction properties, making it suitable for use in automotive swash plate compressors.
* Various modifications and variations can be made to the coating process without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides novel chemical compounds suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for forming submicro-patterns using 193 nm (Arf) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams in the manufacture of semiconductor devices. The polymers of the present invention are designed to absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths to prevent the standing wave effect and light reflection in lithography processes, and to eliminate rear diffraction and reflected light from lower layers.
* The polymers can be prepared through specific reactions involving polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine. The resulting anti-reflective coatings are cross-linked structures that are spectroscopically stable under conventional photolithographic conditions. These coatings have been found to be effective in forming submicro-patterns in photolithographic processes using various light sources, including ArF, E-beam, EUV, and ion beam light sources.
</summary>

<summary> 
• The invention describes the production of a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with specific additives to improve properties such as UV resistance, flame retardancy, and mechanical strength. 
• The film is produced using masterbatch technology, precrystallization, and predrying, and can be used for various applications such as interior decoration, promotional items, and construction materials. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention involves a method for producing 143a by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The process achieves very high conversion rates and selectivity for 143a, exceeding 99%.
• Catalysts such as CrF3 and Cr/Ni/AlF3 are used to efficiently convert 142b to 143a without forming olefinic byproducts.
• The process can be run at various temperatures, pressures, and contact times to optimize conversion and selectivity.
• The catalysts can be regenerated for prolonged use, and the process can effectively remove low levels of olefinic materials from the final product.
• Adiabatic reactors have been used to demonstrate the efficiency of the process in converting 142b to 143a with minimal olefin formation.
• The process can also handle co-feeds of 141b and 142b, showing versatility in handling different feed compositions while maintaining high conversion rates and selectivity for 143a.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for deacylation and desulfurization of pyrazolotriazoles using hypophosphorous acid to reduce impurities and increase product yield.
• Pyrazolotriazoles are difficult to synthesize, and the process involves preparation of triazolothiadiazines followed by desulfurization reactions.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid in the process reduces the formation of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• The process involves reacting acylated compounds with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid to produce the desired pyrazolotriazoles.
• The compounds used in the process have inert substituents, and the process can be conducted in the presence of a catalyst.
• The process is conducted at specific temperatures and pressures, with reaction times ranging from 0.5 to 10 hours, resulting in high yields of the desired product.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots.
* The method involves measuring the entire quantity of each fiber lot before each pass, determining a partial quantity, and continuously removing only the calculated quantity from each fiber lot.
* The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device to ensure precise removal of fiber quantities from each fiber bale.
* The control device coordinates the operation of the bale opener based on signals from the quantity measuring device to maintain a predetermined time schedule for fiber removal.
* The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without residual fibers and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
* The apparatus can be used to open fiber bales of different heights, with predetermined partial quantities removed in each pass until the desired mixture is achieved. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at angles of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric, held together by stitching or adhesive bonding.
• Traditional fabric formation methods like knitting and weaving are not suitable for modern uses requiring structural strength, leading to the development of non-woven fabrics for applications like high-speed airplane parts.
• The invention allows for the formation of parallel courses of bias laid fabrics by using a synchronized rake mechanism with needles to ensure yarn placement and density control.
• The apparatus includes conveyors with needles, yarn carriers moving back and forth between the conveyors, and rake systems with angled needles to interact with the yarns.
• The density of the fabric can be controlled by overlapping return courses on first courses, achieved without loss of parallelism, and the loops formed by the yarns can be cut away after bonding.
• The invention provides a method for forming bias laid fabrics with improved strength, uniformity, and density, suitable for structural applications like airplane parts. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces.
• Different weft carrying forces are achieved by ejecting air under different pressures or for different intervals of time from subnozzles along the warp shed.
• The weft carrying forces can be regulated by varying the spacing of subnozzles, the orifice diameters, or the pressure of air supplied to the subnozzles.
• The weft insertion apparatus ensures stable weft insertion, prevents wasteful consumption of pressurized air, and allows for the insertion of various kinds of weft threads with suitable weft carrying forces. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving bast fibres to improve flexibility and reduce breakage rates.
* The process includes steps such as health preserving, opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning the bast fibres, with variations in temperature, humidity, and duration of health preservation.
* Experiments conducted with different combinations of bast fibres and other fibres show a significant reduction in end breakage rates, leading to improved work efficiency and product quality. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to nip presses used in various industries, particularly papermaking, and provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of covered rolls with imbedded sensors.
• The invention involves strategically placing multiple sets of sensors at different cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to measure pressure, calculate average pressure readings, and create a more accurate nip pressure profile by compensating for rotational variability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and holder for an ironing board, designed to support the cord of an electric iron and hold articles like spray starch or beverage containers. It includes a clamp for securing to the ironing board, a flexible cord support, an article holder, and an electrical receptacle for the iron's plug.
* The cord support is flexible with a spring section, detachable from the clamp, and can be raised or retracted. The article holder is detachable and includes a base and vertical supports, while the electrical receptacle is mounted on an extension portion of the clamp.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for sewing machines.
* Different materials may cause buttonholes to not close or stitches to overlap.
* The buttonhole controlling device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly, and an adjustable stop.
* The device allows for precise control over the length and closure of buttonholes.
* The device operates by engaging a tripping lever on the sewing machine.
* Operators can adjust the device to ensure perfect buttonholes are sewn.
* The invention provides a solution for creating neat buttonholes in various types of materials.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor with an endless sieve belt, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The textile web is spread out in a single layer through a dwell loop, allowing the liquid to act on the substances to be removed for a longer time.
* The apparatus is suitable for various materials, including knitted fabrics, and prevents smudging in printed materials during washing.
* The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass with freely rotatable rollers or by a drum with guide rollers for less resistant materials.
* The suction device removes the liquid and substances from the textile web, maintaining low tension in the fabric.
* The compact design of the apparatus allows for efficient washing without stacking the fabric, improving the washing effect.
* The fabric treatment apparatus provides effective washing without soiling, making it suitable for soilage washing applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a dry cleaning machine with separate air flow and solvent flow systems to minimize the loss of solvent vapors.
• The solvent flow system includes a pump, filters, diverter valves, and a recirculation path to clean the clothes in the tubs.
• During the dry portion of the cycle, the solvent is directed through filters in a reverse backwash operation.
• The air flow system includes oneway valves, an exhaust blower, and hoses connected to the header chamber and outer tub.
• The air flow system prevents the escape of toxic solvent vapors when the access door is opened.
• During the dry portion of the cycle, valves are opened to circulate heated air through the tubs for drying the clothes.
• A refrigeration system is used to condense solvent vapors in the condenser housing during the dry portion of the cycle.
• The refrigeration system includes a compressor, evaporator coils, and expansion valves to maintain the solvent at a predetermined temperature.
• The controls include a timer, door switch, control box switch, and a "cartridge dry" switch for drying filter cartridges. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention involves a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing.
• Conventional spinning systems include eductive and non-eductive systems, each with their own limitations.
• The present invention improves web formation control by using a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width.
• The system uses quench fluid for both cooling the filaments and drawing them through an impingement slot.
• The system allows for easy adjustment of filament denier by changing the slot opening size.
• The filaments are exposed to a high-speed air stream after exiting the slot, leading to improved energy transfer and web formation.
• The system is flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions.
• The method and apparatus are simple, efficient, and cost-effective compared to conventional spinning systems.
• The invention has various applications, including forming nonwoven webs for sanitary products, garments, filtration, automotive carpet, and more.
</summary>

<summary>
• The first embodiment of the sewing machine includes receivers 94 and 95 to detect ultrasonic waves transmitted from an ultrasonic pen, allowing for precise identification of a specified position on the work cloth.
• The second embodiment introduces an embroidery unit with receivers 84 and 85 attached to the carriage, enabling accurate positioning of the embroidery frame for sewing.
• In the third embodiment, the ultrasonic pen emits an electromagnetic wave signal detected by the sewing machine's electromagnetic wave detector, eliminating the need for a cable connection.
• The fourth embodiment adds a receiver 96 to the sewing machine, allowing for the detection of ultrasonic waves from the ultrasonic pen without the use of an electromagnetic wave output circuit.
• By calculating propagation times and distances between receivers and specified coordinates, the sewing machine can accurately determine the specified position for sewing.
• The placement of receivers on different parts of the sewing machine or embroidery unit ensures optimal detection of ultrasonic waves and precise identification of specified coordinates.
• The use of electromagnetic wave signals or additional receivers enhances the flexibility and accuracy of specifying positions on the work cloth for sewing.
• Each embodiment offers a unique approach to simplifying the process of setting sewing positions and angles on the work cloth, improving user experience and sewing accuracy.
• By incorporating innovative technologies such as ultrasonic pens and electromagnetic wave signals, the sewing machine provides efficient and user-friendly sewing capabilities.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by using wool particles or bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives.
• Wool particles are pulverized into ultrafine powder to carry functional additives like zinc oxide or titanium dioxide, providing enhanced durability to cellulosic fabric materials.
• Bamboo powder is also pulverized into ultrafine powder and mixed with wool particles to create a preparation for application onto fabric materials.
• The preparations are applied onto fabric materials using printing, padding, or foam application methods, enhancing properties like ultraviolet protection, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle recovery.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an automatic quilting machine for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads and quilts, with separate computers controlling sewing machine functions and table movements.
• The system includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns, allowing for hand-drawn patterns to be converted into machine-readable language and sewn into the fabric.
• By segregating the control of sewing functions and table movements, reprogramming is simplified, enabling quick modifications to the pattern without having to reprogram the entire system, resulting in increased production efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image for various consumer applications.
* Conventional textile fabric production involves multiple steps from carding to weaving, while nonwoven fabrics are more efficient as they are produced directly from the carding process.
* Nonwoven fabrics can be enhanced with support layers like spunbond material to improve physical properties and durability.
* Hydroentanglement techniques have been developed to impart images or patterns to nonwoven fabrics, enhancing their physical properties and appearance.
* The method involves providing precursor webs with different fibrous matrices, interposing a support layer, and subjecting them to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The resulting fabric can be used in various applications like hygiene products, medical gauze, wipes, protective wear, and apparel construction, offering improved durability and aesthetic appeal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted when contacted by the strip.
* Control means are actuated by the strip to control the switching functions of the sewing machine.
* The device ensures continuous operation, allowing for sewing of relatively stiff strips of material.
* The stop is mounted on a lever that can be moved and biased by a spring.
* A setting means in the form of an air cylinder is used to displace the stop perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece.
* The device simplifies the process of sewing strips of material onto fabric and is insensitive to disturbances. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments.
* Traditional methods involve sewing the knit fabric, leading to increased thickness and decreased productivity.
* The new method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* The method includes overlaying loops of the final course of both knit pieces and gradually binding them off to connect the pieces.
* The process is repeated until the two pieces are fully connected by the knitting machine.
* The method prevents the end portions of the knit fabric from loosening and ensures a secure junction.
* The knitting machine used has multiple knitting needles on needle beds that can move back and forth.
* The method can be applied to various garments like sweaters, tank tops, baseball stockings, and aprons.
* The process involves transferring loops between the moving and fixed needle beds to create a seamless connection.
* The method allows for precise control and automation of the knitting process for consistent results. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, made of stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic material, produced using a production line with various components like a reel, extruder, and cooling trough.
* The stranded cables consist of a core strand sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material layer, increasing flexibility and adhesion between the cables and the jacket.
* The production line includes an extruder with a thread guide and matrix that can be adjusted to ensure precise positioning of the stranded cables in the jacket.
* The method involves degreasing and preheating the cables before sheathing them in the extruder with liquefied plastics material, resulting in improved adhesion and long-term durability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, designed to prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing while minimizing hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop.
* The arrangement includes cams on both sides of the bobbin housing, a spring rod between the cams, and a capsule release device for giving the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
* By positioning all holding means on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, the needle thread loop can be expanded and pulled back unhindered, resulting in a jerk-free and low-friction motion.
* The use of the capsule release device reduces the needle thread tension required for stitch formation, providing improved sewing properties without hindering the motion of the needle thread loop. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves the production of silicon-based nanowires and films using liquid silane inks in electrospinning processes, with the potential for various applications such as in composite materials, electronic devices, and batteries.
* Different formulations of liquid silane inks were tested, including combinations with polymers, accelerants, and solid phases, resulting in the formation of nanofibers that were transformed through thermal or laser processing to produce amorphous or crystalline silicon materials.
* Characterization of the resulting materials showed the presence of silicon, carbon, and other elements, with variations in resistivity and specific capacity, demonstrating the potential for these silicon-based materials to be used in various applications such as lithium-ion battery electrodes. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is directed to controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders and braking elements.
* Existing creel arrangements automatically adjust braking force as spool wind diameter decreases.
* Different control methods include electromagnetic brakes, pneumatic biasing, and central control of tension.
* The invention allows for individual and global tension control in the creel.
* A pneumatic biasing arrangement influences tensioning levers without hindering their movement.
* The use of a magnetic system for braking allows for rapid braking action when needed.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a sewing machine detector that accurately detects the position of the sewing needle and the speed of the machine by using light shielding discs and optical fibers.
• The detector includes reflecting portions and linearly supported optical fibers to reduce stress and ensure stable operation, even in the presence of shaft vibration.
• Additionally, the detector features a power indicating light system that does not interfere with the control circuitry, providing a reliable and durable solution for sewing machine operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention presents a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through critical operations like completion of coagulation and treatment with water of non-alkaline pH.
* The process results in a finished yarn with a high degree of whiteness, eliminating the need for additional treatments to improve whiteness, and can be carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min.
* By following the specified conditions, the process produces yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45, while reducing the number of treatments and achieving a higher degree of whiteness than commonly accepted. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the issue of oxygen entrained in pulp during bleaching, causing foam in the vacuum washer and hindering chemical and water passage.
* Previous deaeration methods involved expensive equipment like the Deculator process or large degassing chambers, which were costly and required pressure vessels.
* The inventors developed a small deaeration tank with no moving parts, designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor for efficient deaeration before washing.
* The tank features an inlet pipe, outlet, and swirl inducing inlet pipe for optimal deaeration, with the swirl inducing fluid being filtrate from the washer.
* The tank is cylindrical with specific dimensions for optimal performance, including the location and size of the inlet and outlet pipes.
* The system involves a process where oxygenated pulp is deaerated in the tank before being washed in a pulp washer, with the height of the slurry in the tank controlled by a sensor. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced composite materials with high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio, designed using a function-oriented material design process.
• The composite structures include tendon elements, stuffer members, joints, and panels, with various configurations such as flat, curved, and sandwich structures, enhancing structural performance and versatility.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures, designed to dissipate energy during dynamic events and limit damage to the structure. It can undergo plastic deformation to absorb high lateral loads and be easily replaced after deformation.
• The device is connected to the brace in the braced frame structure and can withstand high dynamic loads without undergoing plastic deformation at low loads. It is designed to form plastic hinge mechanisms to dissipate energy and can be checked for plastic deformation after a seismic event.
• The load-limiting device can be used in various structures, such as buildings, vehicles, and bridges, and is adaptable to different bracing configurations. It is designed to maintain ductility during severe load cycles and can be easily removed and replaced if plastic deformation is detected after a dynamic event.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities, providing individual rooms in existing buildings.
* The bedroom cabinet features a dual construction with inner and outer casings, allowing for flat external surfaces, efficient utilization of space, and improved sound-proofing and ventilation capabilities. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable guard rail support for construction sites.
• Safety barriers are necessary for personal safety and to prevent hazards.
• Traditional methods involve using lumber which can be time-consuming and costly.
• The portable guard rail support includes a base plate, upright column, rail brackets, kick board flange, brace, and safety tie-off ring.
• A concrete-filled steel base is also provided for stability when anchoring is not possible.
• The guard rail support can be used to create a safety barrier with wooden rails and kick boards.
• The safety tie-off ring can be used for safety cables or weatherproof tarpaulins.
• An alternative configuration with U-beams can also be used for a mesh-like safety barrier.
• The guard rail support is easy to install and remove, reducing liability risks.
• The all-steel construction ensures durability and cost savings for repeated use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to enhance production and recover crude oil components.
* The method involves deploying tools in wells to generate acoustic and electromagnetic pulses to stimulate hydrocarbon flow, with the recovered fluids separated into components such as hydrocarbons, gases, and heavy metals using various separation processes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosure describes a splice for a soil reinforcing element, allowing for the extension of the element's length to reinforce a vertical facing in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
* The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to receive transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, preventing lateral movement and ensuring a secure connection.
* Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to create a composite soil reinforcing element of the desired length, providing flexibility in reinforcing MSE structures. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a plow blade design with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, allowing for efficient production and easy maintenance. Different embodiments include variations in the length of the fluid tube, number of leading edge sections, and location of stitch welds to tailor the plow for specific applications. The fluid is ejected at controlled locations and flow rates to reduce friction and drag during plowing operations.
* Another embodiment includes a manifold between the blade and leading edge sections, with drilled holes for fluid flow and nozzles for controlled injection. The design allows for easy modification using hand tools without welding. A preferred embodiment places the fluid tube on the rear side of the blade, protected by plates, and includes a bottom end section with a void for fluid transfer to the front edge of the blade. The design provides flexibility in fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an evolution of the MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall System, incorporating proprietary plaster and reinforcement materials.
• The system requires a continuous concrete foundation or slab edge thickening under all walls and is fixed to timber framing with specific spacing and treatment requirements.
• Movement control joints are strategically located to accommodate changes in elevation, openings, and wall length, with vertical and horizontal control joints provided as needed.
• Components such as battens, mesh sheets, uPVC mouldings, and sealants are used in the system to ensure structural integrity and durability.
• The system is designed to resist wind face loading up to VH wind speed zones and is suitable for wet timber framing conditions.
• Reinforcement at corners and around joinery is provided by uPVC Kwik corners and flanges, while fibreglass mesh is used for additional reinforcement.
• The plaster system consists of multiple coats, including a base coat, levelling coat, and top coat, with a water repellent sealer applied for moisture resistance.
• The system is completed with a waterproof coating system and is intended to meet the performance requirements of the Building Code, including structural integrity, durability, fire resistance, and external moisture protection.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe with a valuables chamber and a steel door that can be inserted and locked in place using grooves and a lockbolt mechanism. The door is reinforced with safety bolts to prevent damage from prying attempts, providing a secure and efficient locking system.
* The safe construction includes a liner with grooves for the door edges to slide into, along with reinforcing bars and concrete for structural integrity. The lockbolt engages a notch in the liner, with safety bolts preventing damage to the lock mechanism in case of forced intrusion. The design allows for easy assembly and removal of the door while ensuring high security against unauthorized access.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations at desired depths without being influenced by pressures above and below the measuring apparatus.
• Traditional piezometers and pressure transducers have limitations in accurately measuring formation pressures due to volume and connection issues.
• The invention involves cementing a conduit with a filter at the bottom of a borehole, clearing the filter of grout, and displacing grout to form a fluid connection with the formation.
• Another embodiment includes fracturing the formation to create a communication path between the filter and the formation, allowing accurate pressure measurements.
• The pressure transducer can be installed at the desired depth in the borehole, isolated from other formation pressures, and periodically calibrated or relocated for optimal monitoring.
• The method provides a reliable connection system for measuring formation pressures accurately and effectively in geological formations. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member.
* The structure is designed to prevent tire fallen-in and stuck-in situations, ensuring smooth and safe vehicle traveling.
* The jointing structure includes laminated rubbers mounted inside steps with a joint block across the expansion gap.
* The use of high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete provides durability and slip resistance to tires.
* The structure allows for easy maintenance and adjustment of expansion gaps to accommodate temperature changes.
* By decentralizing the expansion gap and using elastic members, the structure prevents tire issues and ensures smooth vehicle traveling. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment.
* Traditional methods of cooling cooked meat products using chilled air cause dehydration, while newer methods use a brine solution for quick heat transfer.
* Overhead rail systems have limitations in flexibility and contamination, leading to the development of wheeled floor trucks for mobility.
* The enclosed floor track system prevents contamination of the brine solution by segregating the wheels of the hand trucks.
* Different embodiments of the system include a wheel channel for horizontally axled trucks and inflatable seals for trucks with downwardly depending struts.
* The system allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving resources and providing economic advantages. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The lock device prevents a work machine from tilting due to its weight, specifically preventing a backhoe boom from rotating downward.
* The lock device includes an engaging member on the boom or boom bracket, an engaged member on the other, and guide members to support and guide the engaging member.
* The lock plate can be easily operated manually, with features such as a hook part, slot, and guide members for stability.
* The lock device is suitable for various work machines like excavators, loaders, and cranes, providing a secure locking mechanism for storage and transportation. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable central vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.
• Prior art devices lacked the ability to adjust suction pressure during cleaning operations.
• The present invention allows for real-time regulation of suction by adjusting the spacing between the suction head and the pool bottom.
• Adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head for easy operation.
• The apparatus enables precise regulation of suction without the need to adjust the suction source.
• The invention can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minor modifications.
• The suction head assembly includes outboard and inboard roller assemblies for adjusting the platform's height above the pool bottom.
• A specially configured frame member spans the platform and allows for precise adjustment of the central suction portion.
• The invention can be provided in kit form for retrofitting existing pool cleaning devices.
• The adjustable pool vacuum head provides a simple, cost-effective, and easy-to-use solution for regulating suction efficiency during pool cleaning operations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, collars for mounting on drill pipe, and a retriever section for engaging with the wear bushing.
* The retriever section can move vertically along the mandrel to prevent damage to the wear bushing during retrieval.
* Different embodiments of the retriever section allow for engagement with wear bushings through protruding members or threaded ends.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a downhole vibratory tool that allows passage for wireline or other tools to pass through and can be closed by landing a plug on a seat.
• The tool features modular stacked pistons to increase power delivery, annular dump valve to prevent slamming against a seat, and a simple plug for activation.
• The design eliminates impacts on valve components, allows for longer trouble-free service, and reduces wear on the valve.
• The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, providing large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string for various downhole operations.
• Additionally, the tool may include a rotational lock between the mandrel and housing for torque transmission. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a precast concrete retaining wall system that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts for assembly on-site. The system consists of a face panel with integral counterforts and a solid base, connected using rebar and grout for stability. The system eliminates the need for temporary shoring during installation and allows for customization in size and design.
• The system can include additional features such as drainage openings, shear keys for connection, and options for adding vehicle impact barriers. Installation options include using H-piles for added stability, creating pockets in the base for pile insertion, or utilizing a cast-in-place pile cap. The system provides a cost-effective and efficient solution for constructing retaining walls in various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production by addressing issues such as clogging and viscosity.
• The down hole heating system of the present invention focuses heat where it is most needed, contains heat in the production zone, and protects electrical components from damage caused by down hole fluids, resulting in increased flow rates and long-term reliability.
• The system includes components such as production tubing, heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, all designed to effectively heat oil and paraffin in situ and promote flow to the well bore for pumping. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to down hole tools for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects.
* Objects lost in wells are referred to as "fish," and various tools like pull tools, grap pling devices, and spears are used for fishing operations.
* The invention provides a mechanism for effective connection and disconnection of pull tools to down hole objects.
* The mechanism includes a catch mechanism with locking and unlocking positions for controlling the connection with objects in the well bore.
* The mechanism allows for simple mechanical movement of a wire line controlled pulling tool to achieve disconnection from objects in the well bore.
* The pulling tool can be an external overshot or an internal spear, both with telescoping inner and outer body structures for gripping objects.
* The mechanism includes a controllable locking mechanism with guide pins and spring elements for latching and unlatching the tool from objects.
* The tool can be used for overshot type grappling and removal of objects from well bores, with interchangeable collet or slip structures for gripping objects.
* The mechanism allows for repeated latching and unlatching cycles without the need for resetting, making it efficient for various down hole service operations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate of at least 4 mm thickness and a base substrate of at least 12 mm thickness, assembled with multidirectional holding means to prevent deformation and detachment.
• The multidirectional holding means include dendrites, glue, and clamps to ensure a firm bond between the base and sight substrates, increasing the durability and allowing for corrective maintenance when needed.
• The example composed stave floors provide improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties, offering a longer lifespan and eliminating the issues of deformation and detachment seen in conventional stave floors. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments that provide lateral stability, prevent slipping, and avoid damaging work surfaces.
* Traditional ladders can be unstable and damage work surfaces due to limited contact area and inability to straddle corners.
* The ladder attachments include large contact area braces with U-bolts, resilient pad assemblies, and adjustable clamps for secure positioning.
* The attachments improve ladder stability, increase contact area with work surfaces, and allow ladders to straddle corners without losing stability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation during driving and increasing holding power in the substrate.
