The collation system includes collar portions that capture the fastener shanks and connecting portions between adjacent collars, with various configurations to influence separation at desired locations.
• The plastic material used in the collation system is an adhesive polymer, such as a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, providing high adhesion to the fasteners. The collation system can be coiled for use in driving tools and includes features like tapered collars, embossed patterns, and deformations on the nail shanks to enhance penetration into the substrate. Overall, the present invention aims to reduce debris, increase holding power, and provide a more efficient and effective collated fastener system for construction applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants in artifacts and machines like automobiles, trains, ships, and aircraft.
• The nozzle has a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button for precise sealant application.
• It can be used manually with cartridges or with automated injection machines.
• The design allows for encapsulating rivets and nuts with sealant for airtight and watertight seals.
• The injection button has channels and orifices for accurate sealant dispersion.
• The invention simplifies sealing work, reduces application time, and improves the quality of sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to position sensors for monitoring moving objects in mechanical systems.
* The sensors aim to reduce the number of wires required for monitoring multiple sensors by using a two-wire current output system.
* The sensors generate signals proportional to the distance between the object and a fixed position, but unwanted noise signals are also produced.
* The sensors include a waveform generator and error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and eliminate static signals and errors.
* A window reference circuit compares the desired sensor output to the existing output and adjusts it within preset high and low reference signals.
* The error correction generator uses a closed-loop compensation circuit to constantly compare the sensor output to a desired minimum value.
* The sensor system includes a controller with logic to adjust the sensor output based on the window comparator input and timing signals.
* The sensor draws minimal current upon startup and can be recalibrated easily by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor modulates current across two wires connected to a monitoring system, converting it into a modulated sensor signal voltage.
* The design allows for rapid recalibration in response to sudden changes in system parameters, ensuring accurate monitoring of moving objects. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines in automobiles.
* It aims to control valve timing for intake and exhaust functions efficiently and effectively.
* The system eliminates the need for springs in valve actuation, allowing for higher engine speeds.
* Variable valve displacement is achieved by rotating a circular disk to adjust valve opening.
* The system can control multiple valves per cylinder, offering flexibility in engine performance.
* Computer control allows for precise timing and sequencing of valve operations.
* The system reduces gas consumption and maximizes engine performance.
* The invention simplifies valve control, improves engine efficiency, and is easily manufacturable. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, with a focus on controlling white and blue light for color temperature adjustments.
• The light member includes a housing with a lighting control region on the bottom side, allowing for the addition of one or more light-emitting modules.
• Each module emits either white or blue light, with electrical connectors coupling to specific control channels for power supply.
• Modules can be easily installed and removed from the lighting control region, with options for different LED colors and optical elements for light direction.
• In-line timers and remote control options are available for controlling the light member, with the ability to set on/off times and dimming levels.
• The light member can also be used under cabinets for lighting, with the option to link multiple light members together in a series for a cohesive lighting setup.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, aiming to improve cooling efficiency and simplify production.
* The apparatus includes separate inserts, in the form of strips, that are inserted into the blade after casting, replacing the traditional cast separating walls.
* These inserts are guided and secured in place by holders integrated into the blade structure, allowing for flexibility in design and efficient cooling.
* By using inserts instead of cast walls, the apparatus reduces weight, thermal stresses, and complexity, while enabling easy adjustments to the cooling system.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a system and method for controlling fuel delivery systems in vehicles, allowing for automatic or manual control to optimize performance and efficiency.
• The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to set the throttle position for ideal vehicle performance, smoothly switching between automatic and manual control without lurching or stalling.
• By using a stepper motor or DC motor, the system ensures full vehicle operation under manual control, preventing limitations to low speeds and providing a safe and efficient driving experience.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste, aiming to reduce pollution emissions and improve combustion efficiency.
• The waste fuel burner operates by forming a conical pile of waste fuel fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel, and then partially oxidizing volatile gases in a primary combustion chamber before complete combustion in a secondary chamber.
• The burner design allows for minimal particulate emissions, little slag or clinker formation, effective burning of wet wood, self-regulation, and fast response times to load changes, making it suitable for various industrial applications requiring clean burning waste fuel. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration in the field of air conditioning, focusing on cooling air without adding water vapor.
* The system uses a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling without increasing moisture content.
* By recirculating return air from the load and using fresh air on the dry side, the system efficiently cools the enclosure with a high heat exchanger efficiency.
* A hybrid system combines evaporative cooling with a vapor compression refrigeration unit, dehumidifying a portion of the cooled air stream to further reduce the dry bulb temperature.
</summary>

<summary>
* The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir.
* Each pump head has an impeller driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads.
* The pump heads are connected by combiners to combine fluid flow before exiting the pump heads.
* The pump can be mounted on different support structures like a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer.
* The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance by allowing for the insertion of additional pump heads for increased operating pressure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing the number of components and improving engine robustness.
• The engine includes a modular system with hydraulic engine brakes for a portion of the cylinders, activated during the compression stroke to provide engine braking horsepower as needed.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure like an auxiliary gearbox for aircraft gas turbine engines.
• Extreme loads, such as blade-off events, can cause damage to gearboxes and peripheral systems, leading to potential oil leakages.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and dampen extreme shocks.
• The gearbox assembly includes driveshaft connections, peripheral load connections, a seal, and mounting links to secure the gearbox to the engine.
• The mounting link consists of a female link with a cavity to receive a male link, a pin to selectively retain the links, and a plug to prevent unintentional removal of the pin.
• The pin serves as a fusible link that shears under extreme loads, allowing the female and male links to translate relative to each other.
• The radial interface between the female and male links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation, preventing damage to the gearbox and attached peripherals.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads, making maintenance easier by replacing the pin after any shock event. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts, as well as balancing arrow shafts, addressing issues with stress on shaft walls and dirt entering shafts.
* The invention includes a point cap system for adjustable weight, a balance pin for balancing arrow shafts, and means for attaching points without allowing dirt to enter the shaft, improving the overall performance and durability of arrows.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training in the military, providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.
• The simulator utilizes an electronically controlled system with a plastic expendable housing containing pyrotechnic charges, which are ignited by an electrical ignition system.
• The circuitry includes various functional blocks such as bolt and trigger interfaces, oscillators, firing counters, decoders, and firing control, all working together to simulate the firing of small arms.
• The simulator is designed to be cost-effective, reliable, and reusable, providing a safe and realistic training experience without modifying the actual weapon.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes a tank with two interconnected pipes of different cross-sectional areas to improve engine performance and reduce intake noise.
• The device includes a control valve actuated by engine operating conditions, with the valve opening at specific engine speeds and loads to optimize engine performance while minimizing noise levels. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or equipment to poles, flat surfaces, or other structures.
• It allows for easy installation by one person and can be used on surfaces of different sizes.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket for mounting the object.
• The system uses minimal components for economic and time efficiency during installation.
• The adjustable bracket can be rotated and locked into position for secure mounting of the object. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosed concepts provide an efficient, clean burning burner with a system for attaching modular heat utilizing appliances.
• The burner includes a combustion chamber with secondary and tertiary combustion air flow paths, a pivotally coupled ash pan, and a cover to prevent ingress of objects and live embers.
• The burner also features manual couplings for attaching various modular heat utilizing appliances, such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on improving fuel economy and durability of rotary internal combustion engines by addressing cooling issues, particularly around spark plug bosses.
* The design features staggered spark plug bosses in the cooling system to enhance heat transfer and prevent vapor accumulation, resulting in a more efficient combustion process.
* Through testing and analysis, the staggered configuration was found to increase the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44%, leading to better cooling performance and reduced risk of structural failure in the engine housing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing by using control valve positions as feedback.
* The method involves calculating total mass flow through parallel control valves based on valve position to maintain steam boiler pressure and turbine power constant during testing.
* Graphs and block diagrams illustrate the compensation process for maintaining flow through the remaining control valves when one valve is closed for testing.
* Testing of the method showed a significant reduction in pressure excursions during turbine control valve testing compared to traditional methods. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically designed for an aircraft cleaning apparatus.
* The valve allows for a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
* It provides continuous analog control over the strength of the cleaning solution by adjusting the mixture proportion between soap solution and water.
* The valve body has multiple passages for receiving soap solution and water, with a valve means to direct the fluids towards the outlet passage.
* A flow restricting device reduces the flow rate of the fluids, ensuring constant pressure at the inlet passages.
* The valve assembly includes a spool valve with adjustable components for controlling the mixture ratio.
* Rotational movement of the valve handle changes the proportion of soap solution and water in the outlet mixture.
* The design allows for multiple users to operate identical valve systems from common soap solution and water sources without affecting fluid pressure. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, by compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and feeding it back to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure.
• Natural gas is transported over long distances in large pipelines, requiring compressor stations to increase gas pressure back to nominal levels. In permanent frost areas, cooling the gas after compression is crucial to prevent ground thawing and pipe ruptures.
• Conventional cooling methods using re-cooling plants with propane as a cooling agent are expensive, underutilized, and pose safety risks. The present invention offers a method to reduce investments and operational risks by compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
• The method involves compressing gas in multiple stages, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to achieve the desired exit temperature. By utilizing expansion turbines, mechanical energy can be recovered and used for compression, reducing energy consumption.
• During warmer periods, excess pressure is used to ensure proper cooling, while in colder seasons, direct compression to the desired exit pressure is sufficient. The method allows for flexible operation based on changing environmental conditions and throughput requirements.
• The compressor station configuration includes primary compression stages with parallel compressors, additional compressors for excess pressure, and expansion turbines for cooling. By optimizing the compression process, the method offers cost-effective and efficient operation throughout the year.
• Overall, the method provides a more sustainable and cost-effective approach to gas compression in compressor stations, reducing investments, operational risks, and energy consumption while ensuring reliable operation in varying environmental conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• Electronic components produce heat during operation, requiring cooling to prevent overheating and premature failure.
• Cooling fans are commonly used to move air across electronic components for effective cooling.
• A new system eliminates the need for traditional fasteners to secure cooling fans to enclosures.
• The system includes a motor, mounting legs, spring members, and a panel for easy installation.
• The design allows for easy installation and secure attachment of the cooling fan assembly to the panel without the need for additional fasteners.
</summary>

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials, lacking damping, leading to high vibration levels.
* Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration and shock loads on instruments during flight.
* The present invention introduces novel damping features in kinematic mounts to dissipate vibration energy.
* Damping mechanisms, such as spherical and slot dampers, are incorporated into the mounts to reduce vibration.
* The damping materials used in the mounts have frequency-dependent properties to minimize bending stiffness.
* The modified kinematic mounts maintain strength, stiffness, and kinematic features while adding damping capabilities.
* The damping designs significantly increase damping levels, reducing vibration response and load transmission to instruments.
* The mounts can be arranged in various configurations, such as truss structures, to achieve kinematic mount action.
* The mounting scheme can uncouple suspension modes, providing stability and alignment for instruments with rotating parts.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a clutch unit for large power transmission applications, such as in aircraft catapult systems.
* It features interleaved clutch plates and discs with separate piston and cylinder means for each set, allowing for maximum torque transmission and minimal residual drag.
* The clutch unit includes a unique design with segmented clutch discs for easy replacement without disassembly of the entire unit.
* The system also incorporates advanced fluid control mechanisms for cooling and precise pressure regulation, enhancing overall performance and efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a system of combustion and expansion cylinders in a cascading configuration to maximize thermal-to-mechanical efficiency and reduce heat loss, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator in vehicles.
* Water injection is utilized in the expansion cylinders to create steam, and a water recovery system is implemented to recycle water for re-use, reducing the need for a large water tank.
* Catalytic materials are used on surfaces exposed to hot exhaust gases to achieve catalytic conversion within the engine itself, reducing emissions and improving efficiency. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves a method for fabricating steel plates with a precoat, where a portion of the metal alloy layer is removed at the periphery to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas during welding.
* The method includes welding the plates, heat treating them to form an intermetallic alloy compound, and then hot deforming them to obtain parts with good mechanical properties and corrosion resistance.
* Different methods of removing the metal alloy layer, such as brushing or laser ablation, were compared to traditional methods, showing improved mechanical properties and corrosion resistance.
* The fabricated parts are suitable for use in automotive safety components, providing a combination of high strength, impact resistance, and corrosion resistance. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present application is a continuation of a patent application for a SCADA system for energy extracting vessel navigation.
• The invention addresses the need for a system that can remotely control and navigate a mobile structure to extract energy from severe weather patterns.
• The system includes a central service facility for maintenance and energy storage, along with communication systems using GPS and weather satellites.
• The GUI allows human operators to interact with the system, adjusting navigation plans, monitoring vessel performance, and analyzing weather patterns.
• The system utilizes algorithms to optimize energy extraction, control actuators for mechanical adjustments, and predict paths based on weather data.
• The invention allows for remote operation of mobile structures in high-energy environments, enhancing safety and efficiency in energy recovery systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage made from at least one ring element and multiple guide structures for rolling bodies.
* The cage is produced by joining flat material ring segments in succession and welding them together before forming the axial profiling.
* This method reduces production costs by minimizing cutting waste, especially for cages with an internal diameter over 140 mm.
* The flat material ring segments are welded along engagement zones with joint contours that positively interlock the segments.
* The ring segments are punched out from sheet metal material as 120° segments, requiring only three weld points for joining.
* The method involves laser welding the ring segments, forming high-strength weld points with minimal distortion.
* The process includes punching out ring segments from strip material, joining them in a rotary plate, and forming the cage through subsequent welding and forming steps.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present methods and systems involve using global satellite positioning to obtain latitude and longitude coordinates of customer service locations, facilitating efficient customer service in the telecommunications industry.
* The system includes an input device for service technicians, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system to streamline the process of obtaining, processing, and transmitting information related to providing service at customer locations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields includes two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object against interfering fields.
* The control unit processes the output signals of the sensors to generate virtual sensor signals, which are then used in independent control loops to calculate control signals for the coils.
* In cases where two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, feedback effects are accounted for using a feedback matrix to eliminate crosstalk between the systems and optimize compensation. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy.
• The method involves sensing a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are used to furnish at least one resonance site in the sample.
• Resonance sites are introduced into the sample by reacting intrinsic chemical structures with reaction partners.
• The method allows for selective tagging of structures not detectable by CARS microscopy.
• Bioorthogonal reactions proceed without interfering with natural processes in living systems.
• Specific bioorthogonal reactions like Staudinger ligation can be used in the method.
• The method enhances the sensitivity and specificity of CARS microscopy.
• It allows for reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in CARS microscopy.
• The method enables the generation of stable, reproducible background signals for improved quantitative conclusions. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy.
• The system compares segmentations from different sources, such as a "gold standard" segmentation against those from clinicians in training or different software systems.
• The comparison process involves converting segmentations to volume models and identifying missing and extra volume elements to evaluate conformance.
• The system allows for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines and evaluation of those routines with new imaging technology.
• An apparatus for automatically assessing radiation therapy segmentations is provided using an electronic computer executing a stored program.
• The program compares volume models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements, and measures conformance between the segmentations.
• The system allows for custom metric methods to be developed and applied to different structures automatically or semi-automatically.
• The metric method may include parameters for weighting volume elements based on distance and may be customized by the user.
• The system provides a graphical representation of the conformance of segmentations and a quantitative display of the comparison results.
• The invention can be used for training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation programs, and assessing changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to apparatus for executing floating point operations in data processing systems.
• Floating point operations involve manipulating numerical quantities represented by fractions and exponents.
• The complexity of addition and subtraction in floating point format requires aligning fractions and normalizing results.
• The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in floating point units.
• By determining differences in subsets of operand exponent arguments, the subtraction process can be initiated earlier.
• Different procedures are followed based on the subset differences to accelerate the computation of final fraction results.
• The apparatus includes units for detecting subset differences, selecting procedures, and performing subtraction operations.
• The final fraction result is determined based on the differences in operand exponent arguments and subset differences.
• The invention accelerates the computation of floating point operations by starting the process before complete operand argument differences are determined.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a method for tracking specimens acquired from patients in a medical facility using unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, order forms, specimen containers, and blood drawer badges. The computer system stores these codes in a relational manner to ensure accurate specimen collection and processing.
• The method involves inputting barcode numbers into the computer system, comparing them to ensure they are related to the same patient, and generating signals for specimen collection. The system also includes a timer to monitor the time taken for specimen collection and alerts for any discrepancies. Overall, the method aims to reduce errors in specimen labeling and improve the efficiency of specimen processing in medical facilities.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, utilizing GPS and voice recognition technology to provide golfers with distance and other information in a verbal form, incorporated into an article of clothing like a hat or visor.
• The device can also record geographic coordinates of a golf course, including hazards and fairway boundaries, by using a portable computing device equipped with GPS, allowing for easy course recording and sharing among users.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a system and method for accurately checking design rules in semiconductor integrated circuits, specifically for logic and memory circuits, to eliminate false errors and pinpoint real design rule violations.
* The system involves creating customized design rules based on modifying standard logic rules to accommodate the different requirements of memory regions, ensuring that the right set of rules is applied to the right regions in the mask pattern data.
* By categorizing errors into logic, BDSP SRAM, BLSP SRAM, DP SRAM, and ROM groups, the system accurately detects and classifies mistakes in different types of regions on a chip, reducing manual effort and speeding up the design development cycle.
* The invention is applicable to various industries beyond semiconductor design, such as LCD manufacturing, where different design rules must be applied to different regions on a substrate, providing a more efficient and reliable design verification tool.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
• Thin substrate waveguides are used to provide controlled illumination, offering high diffraction efficiencies and compact, rugged arrangements.
• Waveguide holograms can achieve high diffraction efficiencies, with undiffracted light trapped in the waveguide to prevent stray light.
• Illumination depletion and two-sidedness are challenges that can be addressed through a priori or a posteriori compensation methods.
• Aligning sensitivity can be managed by firmly attaching the light source to the waveguide or using spatially and spectrally broad sources.
• Solutions for two-sidedness include absorbing light from one side, using mirrors, or employing off-axis illumination.
• Recording systems for waveguide holograms involve configurations with glass prisms or prism couplers for precise hologram recording.
• Experiments with white light illuminators and coherent laser light show the versatility and quality of the waveguide hologram illuminators.
• The invention allows for flexibility in selecting light sources, objects for illumination, and other parameters, within the scope of the claimed invention.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to identify defects.
• The method and apparatus involve magnetizing the rotor, sensing induced voltages, and determining resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
• Prior art methods for testing rotors include using stator cores or destructive techniques, but the new method is non-destructive and efficient.
• The test apparatus includes test heads with exciting means, voltage sensing means, current sensing means, and processing means for data analysis.
• The test heads have primary windings for magnetizing the rotor, voltage pick-up coils for sensing induced voltages, and skew pick-up coils for effective skew measurement.
• The data acquisition and processing system acquires and processes data to calculate resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.
• The control processor determines pass/fail results based on predetermined threshold values for resistance, reactance, and skew, and stores statistical information for analysis.
• The test fixture structure includes a retraction and drive mechanism to retract and rotate the rotor for testing, with a clutch mechanism to securely hold the rotor in place during rotation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The document describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources to managed libraries with validated digital certificates, while denying access to managed applications without proper authorization.
* The process involves receiving, verifying, and storing executables in digitally signed containers, ensuring that the code is type safe and does not access unauthorized resources.
* Additionally, the document outlines the steps for publishing videogames on a mobile device, including verifying managed metadata, identifying executables, and transmitting digitally signed containers to mobile devices for execution. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between protective layers.
* Smart cards with IC chips are known for credit card transactions, either with contacts or contactless antennas.
* Prior art smart cards used rigid cores and glue or mechanical means to secure components, leading to potential damage and increased production costs.
* The new card design uses shock-absorbing layers with indicia, encased in rigid outer layers for protection.
* The core layer is made of silica-filled polyolefin, with an antenna and chip fixed to it, enveloped by a bottom sheet.
* An alkyd resin spid with an anti-binding agent is printed on the core layer, and a laminate layer is attached to the bottom sheet.
* The card is personalized with dye diffusion thermal transfer printing or inkjet printing on image-receiving layers.
* A protective layer is applied over the printed information to prevent damage and bleeding of dye.
* The invention provides a durable and easily constructed identification card with improved protection for electronic components. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory using a tree-shaped structure, reducing the amount of required copying in a functional memory environment.
* The tree structure maintains a balanced and filled condition, with additions directed to non-full leaf nodes and deletions made in reverse order.
* A header node is added to the structure in a preferred embodiment, allowing for faster and more space-efficient updates, as well as the ability to invert the queue in constant time and space.
* The memory arrangement includes control logic, intermediate registers, and a flag register to manage additions and deletions in the queue efficiently.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies, such as using DRAM technology for EPROM redundancy circuits.
• EPROM devices are manufactured using DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, reducing operation voltages and simplifying supporting circuits.
• Another type of EPROM device, called SEPROM, utilizes transistor properties changed under stress conditions to store data, providing flexibility for embedded applications and security purposes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to determining the optimum value of feedback gain for feedback control systems, such as those used in automatic guidance vehicles.
* Feedback gains, including proportional, integral, and differential gains, are crucial for controlling stability, accuracy, and response in feedback control systems.
* The method involves provisionally determining feedback gains, executing feedback control, calculating evaluation values based on errors, and iteratively adjusting feedback gains to optimize control characteristics.
* Evaluation functions, such as the length of error curves over time, are used to determine the optimum values of feedback gains quickly and accurately, regardless of the subject of control.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range.
* There is a demand for zoom lenses with a compromise between relative aperture and size for photographic and video cameras.
* Video cameras require high relative aperture due to low sensitivity image pickup elements.
* The zoom lens design focuses on increasing relative aperture without compromising optical performance.
* The invention aims to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and reduced size while maintaining optical performance.
* Specific conditions must be met for the construction and arrangement of lens elements in the zoom lens.
* The design of the fourth and fifth lens units plays a crucial role in correcting aberrations for high optical performance.
* Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided with detailed data on radii, thicknesses, refractive indices, and Abbe numbers.
* The total length of the zoom lenses ranges from 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A, achieving a significant reduction in size.
* The invention represents a significant advancement in the reduction of zoom lens size while maintaining high optical performance. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector.
* Charge pulses are generated in the detector when a particle passes through it.
* The charge pulses are converted into electric signals and indicated or recorded.
* Individual signals are amplified in a fast amplifier, and multiple signals are integrated in a slow amplifier.
* The method allows for detection of individual particles and integration of signals without prior knowledge of signal rates.
* Different elements are used to separate signals based on their rates for proper amplification and integration.
* Detector materials can be doped or coated with converter materials for detecting uncharged particles.
* The method and device can be used in various applications such as particle accelerators, medical devices, and power engineering. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes a stationary ring, a movable ring, a torque motor, and an electronic sensor to measure the distance between the rings.
• The torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly to test for warpage.
• A microprocessor controls the operation of the torque motor and generates signals for the operator.
• The program includes steps for engaging the driven disc assembly, applying torque, and measuring rotation to determine warpage.
• If the warpage is within tolerances, the apparatus allows for the removal of the tested assembly.
• If the warpage exceeds tolerances, the operator is alerted, and the defective assembly can be removed.
• The apparatus provides an automated and efficient way to test driven disc assemblies for warpage in friction clutches. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to face age-estimation using a contourlet appearance model.
* The technology is useful for various applications, such as age verification in businesses and security systems.
* The aging process of human faces is influenced by various factors, making age estimation challenging.
* Computer science approaches to face aging are relatively new compared to other aging-related fields.
* The method involves extracting facial features, mapping them to age groups, and using SVMs for classification.
* The system uses Support Vector Regression to construct aging functions for different age groups.
* The age classifier distinguishes between youths and adults based on extracted features.
* The estimated age is generated using growth and development or adult aging functions.
* The system can provide estimated ages with corresponding confidence factors.
* The technology can be implemented in a computing system for efficient face age-estimation. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, such as combining a high-definition monochrome image with a lower-definition color image.
* The matrix display device consists of a controller producing light intensity signals for each pixel and a matrix of pixels organized in arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.
* Different arrangements of pixels can be used, such as one where three pixels display the first image and one pixel displays the second image, or another where two pixels display each image.
* The controller can apply attenuation functions to adjust the light intensity signals for optimal display, especially when combining different colors for the images.
* The matrix display device can be configured to display various combinations of images, such as merging a night vision image with an infrared image and a graphical or textual image, while maintaining image quality and contrast. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system, with a housing containing electronics and a communication means.
* The transmitter includes a removable payment element for cashless transactions, which can be securely stored in a receptacle in the housing.
* A closure protects the receptacle when the payment element is removed, ensuring the functionality of the transmitter.
* The payment element can communicate with a payment system, allowing for secure and convenient payment actions while maintaining the keyless activation of the security system. 
</summary>

<summary>
* An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, may become inactive during periods of non-use and enter a "sleep mode" to save energy. However, prolonged inactivity can lead to a decrease in the tribo charge of the toner, affecting image quality.
* Various exemplary embodiments address this issue by implementing methods and apparatus for charging toner based on periods of inactivity, user usage patterns, and sensor measurements. By predicting user behavior and adjusting the toner charge accordingly, the tribo charge of the toner can be maintained at a predetermined level for consistent image quality.
* The intelligent toner charging system includes components such as an inactivity determining section, a predicting section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section to ensure the toner is charged appropriately for optimal printing operations. These methods can be implemented in software or hardware to improve the efficiency and accuracy of toner charging in imaging devices. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus for controlling the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads with high precision.
• The apparatus includes MR heads, bias current circuits, a regenerative amplifier, and a decoder for controlling the bias currents and operating modes of the heads.
• The bias currents for the MR heads are regulated independently using a single control signal transmitted via a rotary transformer.
• The apparatus allows for precise regulation of bias currents for MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure.
• The control signals include data for regenerative amplifiers and recording current settings for recording heads.
• The apparatus enables switching over among plural heads with high precision, particularly in a rotary magnetic head type apparatus.
• The control data for head switching and bias current control have priority over other control data to prevent signal loss and ensure stable data reproduction. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is about locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects like pipes or cables.
• Two general techniques for locating buried metallic objects are passive and active.
• The invention provides a system and method to locate and trace one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The system includes a transmitter with two antennae and a receiver sensitive to magnetic fields associated with the currents induced in the objects.
• The method involves producing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects and producing an output signal dependent on both fields.
• The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects to improve tracing accuracy.
• The system produces two distinct output signal nulls over respective objects, making it easier to locate and trace them.
• Different techniques are employed to make the currents distinguishable and produce an output signal dependent on both currents.
• The invention is especially useful when the horizontal separation between objects is related to the depth of the object to be located and traced. 
</summary>

<summary> 
• The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to allow hands-free automatic answering and communication. 
• It includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection and a bypass switch for extending the call duration. 
• The device can be used in various settings, such as for the physically handicapped or in business environments, providing a portable and versatile solution. 
• The system can operate in regular mode or automatic mode, with the ability to extend or terminate calls as needed. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on optical fiber communications, specifically on network design and incorporating branch powered amplification.
• Optical fiber amplifiers have significantly increased transmission capacities for digital data in undersea lightwave communications systems.
• The network design aims to ensure connectivity in the event of cable cuts, utilizing trunk and branch structures in a ring topology.
• The system reduces the need for costly undersea repeaters by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered by branch cables.
• The network includes hub assemblies, branching units, cable stations, and optical amplifiers to maintain signal integrity and amplification.
• The branch assemblies allow for convenient add/drop points for telecommunications traffic and utilize light emitting power sources for energy transmission.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to cover plate devices for wiring devices in ganged boxes mounted in building walls, providing a finished look without exposed fasteners.
* The prior art involved using screws to fasten cover plates over wiring devices, resulting in unsightly exposed screws and potential shock hazards.
* The present invention offers a two-part cover plate device with an attachment member and a cover plate member, allowing for easy installation and removal while accommodating variations in wall flatness. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, such as television sets and monitors.
* It consists of concentric annular strips that can be fixed in front of a screen and slide over each other to cover or uncover the screen.
* The strips have decreasing wall thickness, allowing for different viewing angles without hindrance.
* The device can be easily attached to a screen using Velcro and requires minimal parts for assembly.
* An adapter member provides a flat attachment face for the device, allowing it to be fitted to various types of monitors.
* The strips are designed with hook and locking elements for reliable folding and unfolding.
* The invention provides a compact, inexpensive, and reliable solution for preventing light reflections on screens. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to automatically informing a speaker to slow down their speaking rate when it exceeds a threshold that a listener can comprehend, taking into account factors like language proficiency and speech clarity.
* The system includes a device with components like a microphone, sensory mechanism, and speech processors to monitor and compare speaking rates, as well as a network element for remote speech processing and listener profiling to determine appropriate speaking rate thresholds.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, using means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan N lines of a picture plane cyclically. 
• It aims to achieve a higher picture sequence frequency than conventional TV cameras, by utilizing a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a delay device for controlling the vertical deviation of the beam. 
• The device allows for flexible TV recordings of rapid processes with high resolution in time, by adjusting the counting capacity of the programmable counter. 
• By scanning only a fraction of the standard number of lines per picture, the device increases the picture sequence frequency by a factor of 40, sacrificing vertical resolution for improved time resolution. 
• The video signals can be digitized and stored for analysis, with the option to complete missing lines through repetition or interpolation. 
• The device can be adjusted to different counting capacities to optimize time resolution based on the speed of the process being recorded. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call, using a multimedia server with blender software.
• The blender software manages blended calls by initiating voice and multimedia components, controlling signaling paths, and preventing infinite loops between the telephony server and blender.
• Incoming calls to blended clients are routed to the blender, which separates the call request and multimedia request, and passes them to the telephony server and multimedia server respectively.
• Outgoing voice calls from a client are processed conventionally if not supporting blended services, but if supported, the call is passed to the blender for handling.
• Outgoing multimedia calls involve sending an invitation to the client via the blender, separating the invite into call and multimedia requests, and passing them to the telephony server and multimedia server.
• The multimedia server manages the call by controlling signaling paths, offering call disposition handling, and connecting signals from different devices.
• The use of SIP enables access to endpoints' capabilities and URLs, facilitating the setup and management of blended voice and multimedia calls.
• The integration of the Intelligent Network (IN) as a trigger point allows for basic call disposition handling and mid-call activation of multimedia features.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a content synchronization framework for connected devices using dynamic attributes and file bundles.
* The framework involves a central reference point server, client devices, network connectivity, and optional partner servers.
* Client devices send contextual information to the central reference point, which then constructs response bundles based on the client's attributes.
* Bundles contain file descriptions, download priorities, actions, and locations of files to be synchronized.
* The client device creates a delta list of files to be downloaded based on the response bundles.
* Files are downloaded in priority order, and incomplete bundles are rejected in case of connection failure.
* The framework supports resumption of synchronization from the last failed bundle and caching of common server responses for efficiency.
* The synchronization process involves client initialization, context creation, server response building, file updating, and adaptive downloading.
* The process ends when all listed bundles have been successfully downloaded to the client device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for communication between finders and owners of lost objects using unique IDs and virtual locales.
* Owners affix tags with unique IDs to their possessions and register them with their contact information in a centralized database.
* Finders access a website or virtual locale specified on the tag to communicate anonymously with owners.
* Owners can view open cases, edit their account settings, and manage their tagged objects through the system.
* Finders can view open cases, search for IDs, send messages to owners, and open new cases for found objects.
* The system allows for anonymous communication through email, instant messaging, and text messaging between finders and owners.
* The program periodically checks for incoming messages and forwards them to the appropriate parties based on the unique IDs.
* The system can be implemented using open source software and modules for efficient communication and data management.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an electron multiplier using thin foils to create secondary electrons for amplification or detection of particles.
* The foils are arranged in a series of stages with an applied voltage to accelerate electrons through the foils.
* The design allows for a higher gain per multiplication stage, simplifies fabrication, and reduces costs compared to conventional multipliers.
* The foil electron multiplier design also provides position-sensitive information and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.
* The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing foil thickness, material selection, and applied voltage per stage.
* The design uses supporting grids for thin foils and demonstrates higher gain efficiency than conventional multipliers.
* The foil electron multiplier does not experience ion feedback and can be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors.
* The gain of the multiplier increases with applied voltage and number of stages, showing a higher gain efficiency than microchannel plate detectors.
* The foil electron multiplier design offers a more efficient and cost-effective solution for electron multiplication in various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention uses Pulfrich effect to create a 3-dimensional visual effect in motion pictures.
* The system consists of viewing glasses with controllable lenses, a digital sensor, a computer processor, and a lens control algorithm.
* The algorithm processes successive frames of the motion picture to detect lateral motion and synchronize the lens darkness accordingly.
* Different lens states are used based on the direction of lateral motion detected in the motion picture.
* The lenses can be clear-clear, clear-dark, or dark-clear depending on the detected motion.
* The algorithm tracks intensity edges to identify motion and determine the appropriate lens state.
* The system can adapt to different types of motion in the motion picture to create a 3-dimensional effect.
* Head movement can be accounted for by the system to ensure accurate detection of lateral motion.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope provides a seamless 3-dimensional viewing experience for any motion picture without the need for special equipment. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention discloses a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without the need for a wafer saw.
• The method involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer, applying mechanical pressure to cause a clean break along the trenches, and singulating the individual die.
• The process includes steps such as applying a photo resist layer, patterning the wafer, etching trenches, back-grinding the wafer, applying adhesive tape, and applying pressure to break the wafer along the scribe lines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements caused by ionized gases.
* Field emission display devices offer advantages over LCDs, such as higher contrast ratio, larger viewing angle, and lower power consumption.
* The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes that deflect ionized gases away from the cathode to prevent electrical surges and burnout damage.
* The reduction plates can be arranged in elongated parallel strips or in a meshwork/net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements.
* The protection structure significantly prolongs the lifetime of field emission elements in the device and can be fabricated using conventional deposition and etching techniques. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes on different surfaces of the substrate.
* Traditional CCD image sensors are formed on flat, circular semiconductor wafers with image sensor elements on either the top or bottom surface.
* The invention allows for recording information through an edge surface of the sensor, enabling imaging in multiple planes simultaneously.
* The image sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region for generating charge carriers by light.
* The charge carriers are guided towards the collection means by doped layers creating a waveguide-like structure adjacent the edges of the sensor.
* The sensor can be used for various applications, including color imaging with different filters for each imaging plane.
* The invention provides a cost-effective and versatile solution for imaging in multiple planes, enhancing the capabilities of traditional image sensors.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems, aiming to reduce energy consumption.
• Current home networks struggle to enter power save mode while performing network administrative functions.
• The proposed method involves transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
• The network master node sends data to the slave node before entering power save mode.
• The slave node can accept the transfer of network administrative functions and become the new master node.
• Selection criteria for choosing the new master node can be based on visibility or intelligence/functional capabilities.
• The network slave node waits for a transfer request and sends a reply to accept the transfer.
• If selected as the new master node, the slave node receives the network administrative functions.
• The activated device automatically becomes the network master node if no beacons are found on the network.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements for measuring the direction of electromagnetic radiation propagation.
• Low elevation angles are difficult to measure due to interference from ground reflections, especially at low operating frequencies.
• A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of antenna elements was identified in a UK patent to optimize angle measurements.
• The triplet arrangement allows for unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees.
• The antenna array comprises at least four antennae spaced to provide equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
• Radio receiver means obtain information signals from each antenna of each triplet, with amplitude and phase functions of elevation angles and ground reflection coefficient.
• First logic means combine vectorially the information signals from outermost antennae to provide a first derived signal.
• Second logic means derive a second derived signal from the center antenna of each triplet.
• Dividing means divide one derived signal by the other to provide a quotient signal independent of ground reflection coefficient.
• The array can be used for applications such as monitoring aircraft height during landing approaches. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system with a liquid tight seal.
• Traditional subminiature lamps use adhesive to support the glass envelope within a metal sleeve, leading to degradation and failures.
• A new solution involves using a high temperature polymer to directly surround and compress the glass envelope, providing extended sealing, heat resistance, and resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for adhesive, allows for closer tolerance centering of the glass envelope, and provides a longer seal length compared to conventional O-ring seals.
• The seal supported lamp assembly minimizes the number of sealing points, maximizes the length of the seal surface, and includes potting material to minimize air volume and prevent gas penetration.
• Assembly involves inserting the abbreviated height one piece conductive base into the polymeric seal support, injecting potting material, and securing the electrical connections.
• The invention can be applied to any situation requiring insulation, high heat degradation resistance, solvent and chemical resistance, and effective sealing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to precoder configuration in MIMO systems, specifically focusing on reducing computational costs while maintaining optimal capacity.
• Known precoding techniques such as Block Diagonalization and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding are discussed, highlighting their limitations in terms of system capacity.
• The GDFE Precoder is introduced as a high-capacity solution, but its computational cost is prohibitive for real-time implementation in practical systems.
• The proposed method for GDFE Precoder configuration reduces the computational cost significantly without sacrificing system capacity.
• The method involves computing filter matrices C, B, and G based on alternative formulas, providing a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder.
• Numerical examples demonstrate the computation of matrices involved in the GDFE Precoder design, showcasing the effectiveness of the proposed method in reducing computational complexity.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing, specifically an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate without modifying assembly conditions, enhancing heat-dissipating performance.
• A conventional fan typically includes a fan housing and impeller to dissipate heat generated by electrical elements, with restricted airflow due to housing dimensions.
• The invention aims to enlarge intake airflow area by extending the sidewall of the housing outward, allowing for increased airflow rate and enhanced heat-dissipating efficiency.
• The housing design includes an outer frame with a passage for air streams, with the sidewall extending radially outward to enlarge intake or discharge area symmetrically.
• The heat-dissipating device can be mounted in a system casing with electrical elements, improving heat dissipation and preventing damage from high temperatures.
• The housing design may include inclined portions to guide air streams towards the center of the heat sink, enhancing heat-dissipating effects.
• Overall, the invention provides a solution to increase airflow rate, enhance heat-dissipating efficiency, and maintain ease of assembly with existing systems and heat dissipation elements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel capable of displaying images in different colors without the need for an intermediate electrode.
* The panel consists of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including first and second luminescent layers made of different materials to emit different colors.
* By adjusting the driving voltage, the panel can display images in green, lemon (a mixture of green and orange), or other colors depending on the situation.
* The structure of the panel allows for a simple design and low cost production, making it suitable for applications such as instrument panels for automobiles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, comprising audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means for establishing a wireless connection to a connecting unit. The terminal allows for telephony via a network or the Internet, increasing flexibility and eliminating the need for specialized equipment for connection.
• The system includes the communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server connected to the Internet/network. The service server stores user information, facilitates connections between users, and provides additional services like news, music, and chat functionalities. The method involves establishing a wireless connection, transmitting user information to the service server, and establishing connections between users for communication via the Internet/network.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a method for fabricating a structure for semiconductor circuitry using a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on a semiconductor substrate, followed by the deposition of a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
• The use of a germanium buffer layer allows for the epitaxial growth of high dielectric constant oxides on a conductor or semiconductor, providing a diffusion barrier between the high dielectric constant oxides and the semiconductor material, and enabling the fabrication of metal oxide metal or metal oxide semiconductor structures without significantly lowering the effective dielectric constant.
</summary>

<summary>
* Receiver input circuits with preamplifier and mixer arrangements are used in radio and TV receivers.
* The invention aims to eliminate signal distortions by using multiple amplification control loops.
* The first control loop prevents overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes.
* The second control loop prevents overloading of the mixer stage and oscillator due to powerful signals.
* The third control loop supports the other control loops with lower response threshold and bandwidth.
* The input circuit includes PIN diodes for amplification control and protection against signal overloading.
* Tunable networks with varactor diodes allow for iteration-free alignment and improved selectivity in receiver input circuits.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a system for setting up collaborative work-sharing environments between physically distant individuals without complex setup processes. It involves a telephone with a collaborate indicator and button, connected to a PC on a LAN.
* The collaborate indicator signals the capability of collaboration between parties, and the collaborate button allows users to initiate collaboration applications. The system compares supported applications between parties and illuminates the indicator if a match is found.
* The system operates through a call control unit, with steps for call setup, indicating collaboration availability, and ceasing the indication when the call is terminated. The collaboration can be implemented between multiple parties in a shared workspace environment.
* The architecture allows for connections over the Internet, with variations for different types of stations including PCs with multimedia capabilities and FAX applications. The system can be implemented using a computer program on a carrier medium.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to inserting advertising clips into video sequences to optimize visual impact.
* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and advertising clips, determining similarity between the maps, and selecting the clip with the highest similarity.
* Different methods can be used to calculate similarity, such as correlation coefficients or Euclidean distances.
* A device implementing the method includes memory, processing unit, input/output interface, and man-machine interface for detecting shot changes and inserting advertising clips into video sequences.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to using a recessed mask structure to prevent high electrical fields in small semiconductor devices, reducing leakage and breakdown in high-speed integrated circuits.
• The structure involves positioning a mask below the surface to be planarized, away from high electric field points, resulting in lower capacitance and faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.
• The process includes removing mask material after planarization to achieve a selected mask thickness, minimizing damage to the conductive liner and reducing overall capacitance for improved device performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter, eliminating the need for complex discrete-time analog circuitry.
* By placing the sampler inside the predictive loop, the predictive filter can be implemented using DSP techniques, allowing for flexibility and reprogramming of the filter characteristics to match the input signal.
* The dynamic range performance of the digital predictive encoder is extended by utilizing the digital output to control a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input.
* An offset nuller element is incorporated to dynamically detect and remove offsets that would impair the analog-to-digital conversion process, enhancing the DC offset performance of the converter.
* The digital quadrature mixer downconverts the output of the predictive filter to baseband in-phase and quadrature components, simplifying the implementation by selecting specific frequencies.
* The rate reduction filters filter and reduce the sample rate of the in-phase and quadrature components, providing lower noise bandwidth and maintaining high dynamic range in the digital representation of the signal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules. Nanowires and nanotubes are used for label-free detection of biomolecule binding, and nanoimprint lithography is used to fabricate arrays of semiconducting nanotraces for multiplex detection of analytes.
* The fabrication process involves creating a template with nanoscale features, depositing a semiconducting active layer, patterning the nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography, and synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the nanotraces. The anchor probes are specific molecules that bind to target molecules, leading to changes in electrical conductivity that can be monitored externally.
* The detection process involves introducing target molecules to the sensor devices, where they bind to the anchor probes, causing a change in current that indicates the presence of the target. The multiplex detection array allows for simultaneous detection of multiple targets, with each sensor device having a unique anchor probe sequence for specific target identification.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of lead surfaces.
• The method involves providing a leadframe with exposed side surfaces, plating the side surfaces with a non-reactive material, and completing the singulation process.
• Different cutting techniques, such as full cutting or partial cutting with beveled blades, can be used to create different side surface shapes and heights on the semiconductor packages.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is about a dual mode mobile terminal that can connect to both a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local network (WLAN).
* The mobile terminal can switch between WWAN and WLAN based on signal strength and other factors to optimize communication.
* The WLAN gathers information about neighboring base stations from the WWAN, helping the mobile terminal make faster connections.
* The mobile terminal has two wireless modules - one for WWAN and one for WLAN - to facilitate seamless switching between networks.
* The method involves turning on the WWAN module when signal strength from the WLAN drops below a certain threshold.
* If the initial connection attempt fails, the mobile terminal can scan frequency channels or perform all channels scanning to establish a connection. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention simplifies the production of multilayered components by eliminating costly steps involving labor.
* The process involves forming electrodes and electrical components on carriers, stacking them, and removing the carriers to form assemblies.
* Different types of components, such as A, B, and C, are deposited on electrodes to create sub-assemblies for stacking.
* The sub-assemblies are stacked in precise registered relation to form resultant assemblies, such as capacitors, coils, or resistances.
* The process allows for the fabrication of various sizes of assemblies at low cost and high production rates.
* The elimination of cutting operations reduces the risk of micro cracks and delamination issues in the final products.
* The method enables the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and shapes without limitations.
* In-process inspection is enhanced, and end terminations of electrodes allow for a variety of tab configurations.
* The process is adaptable to producing multilayer ferrite inductors, semiconductor packages, and precision registers.
* The method can also be used to create transformer configurations, magnetic amplifiers, solenoids, memory cores, and semiconductor packages with dual line configurations. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to hierarchical lattice structures with unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength.
• The lattice structures can be used as cores for sandwich panels, providing high specific stiffness and strength for various applications including transportation, blast mitigation, thermal transfer, armors, and multifunctional structures.
• The lattice structures can be nested and mated to form balanced structures, which can then have face sheets applied to them for additional support and functionality.
• The lattice structures can be fabricated using injection molding processes, with the resulting unit cells used as templates for the deposition of other materials or for investment casting of metal cores.
• Various methods of manufacture, including die casting, stamping, and extrusion, can be used to create the unit cells for the lattice structures.
• The lattice structures can be curved, allowing for applications such as rocket or jet fuel nozzles, and can be used in a wide range of structural and functional materials.
• The lattice structures can be used for impact or blast energy absorption, heat exchange, catalytic support, energy storage, and a variety of other applications.
• The invention incorporates a multiplicity of cell sizes, allowing for a high surface area and enhanced structural properties in the lattice structures.
• The scope of the invention is defined by the following claims, which encompass all modifications, variations, and equivalents that fall within the spirit and scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons by integrating an IGCC facility with a CTL facility.
• The process includes wet gasification of coal to produce combustion gas at high pressure, which is then enriched with hydrogen and used for power generation.
• Dry gasification of coal produces a synthesis gas precursor, which is mixed with the hydrogen-enriched gas for hydrocarbon synthesis.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, focusing on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface by coating it with a blocking film to prevent oxygen removal.
* The method involves forming a film on the superconducting material, adding oxygen to the surface, and heat treating the material to control the oxygen concentration, resulting in a highly reliable surface utilizing device with long-term stability and high reliability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, allowing for precise cutting of thin foam samples without damaging the delicate cell structure.
• The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism to ensure uniform thickness and parallel cut edges of the foam samples.
• By using the apparatus, foam samples can be prepared for detailed microscopic examination to assess cell structure, cooling quality, blowing agent overload, and other quality control measures. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers designed for ocean floor operation.
* It provides a method to determine the angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer.
* The invention ensures good coupling of seismic detectors to the ocean floor.
* It includes a self-leveling apparatus for seismic motion detectors.
* The invention uses a spring-loaded plunger to lock the detectors in place.
* A solenoid is used to release the plunger and lock the detectors.
* The invention is mounted inside the seismometer's instrument compartment.
* It allows for easy access to the plunger for operation.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive solution for leveling and preserving the orientation of seismic detectors. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a humidity sensing element that is energized by low voltage microscopic currents, does not rely on mechanical movements, is sturdy and does not require special protection, and has a response time of about one second.
• The sensing element consists of an aluminum electrode with a porous dielectric coating impregnated with nickel particles, sealed with an ion-forming material, and overlaid with a nickel electrode. The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with the relative humidity of the surrounding atmosphere when excited by an alternating current voltage.
• The method of manufacturing the humidity sensing element involves coating the electrode with a porous dielectric, depositing nickel particles in the dielectric, sealing the anodized layer, and forming a second electrode. The sensor functions by combining resistance and capacitance to provide a linearly proportional response to changes in relative humidity. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly with a force transmission structure for a window lift system in vehicles.
* The force transmission structure includes a drive plate with a Y-shaped mounting hole and a shaft with a Y-shaped toothed portion, providing stable rotation and reducing noise.
* The drive plate is made of engineering plastics material, with buffer holes for relief during molding, and V-shaped protrusions for engagement with a damper.
* The motor assembly includes a worm, worm gear, damper, drive plate, and shaft, all working together to drive the window lift mechanism efficiently and quietly.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically for detecting, identifying, and monitoring multipath signals in WCDMA systems.
• The system includes an antenna, radio frequency subsystem, and baseband subsystem for generating a mobile time reference.
• A free running counter in the WCDMA modem uses high and low frequency clocks to maintain the mobile time reference during active and idle modes.
